Who: DEEPSTRYKE, NIGHTRAZOR, PHOBIA, Rat Trap, Quickstride
Location: Area a=
round Black Fortress

As Rat Trap and Quickly made their way back to the ar=
ea of the Black
Fortress and Quickstride took a few moments to ingest a few=
 bean pods,
the three fliers had already made it to the doors of the fortre=
ss
itself.

By the time Quickstride and Rat Trap made it to them, the trio =
of
soldiers had already transformed and waiting on a platform on the
other =
side of the pool of magma.

The middle one, the taller of the three by an i=
nch or so, stood with
his arms behind his back in a military stance, waitin=
g.

"Are you sure about this Deepstryke?" said the ebony colored one who
st=
ood off to one side.

The middle one nodded, "Yes Nightrazor. I don't know =
this Hydras yet,
except that he did not put on the best show a few months a=
go, but if
Cyclonus trust him, then perhaps he may be what we need."

The r=
ed and white one, the female soldier said little here as she
looked around,=
 her interest is in the hot magma that surrounded them.
She dropped a bit o=
f debris into the stone and watched it liquefy and
dissolve.

As the odor f=
rom Quickstride made its way over, it had trouble getting
through the smell=
s of sulfur already coming from  the magma that lay
around them, but perhap=
s some of it did because the female looked up.

"There's that smell again,"=
 she said as she straightened and looked
around. "I can think of some inter=
esting uses to put that."

"Yes." said Nightrazor, obviously a mech of few =
words.

"Come." said Deepstryke as the door to the Black Fortress opened,
"=
Cyclonus is awaiting us."

They quickly file inside and the door shuts.

As=
 the door shut a message comes across Qickstride's and Rat Trap's
radio fro=
m Lord Elder, "What's going on over there." he said, his
voice tense and co=
ncerned. "I am not getting any answer from Kup,
Nightshift or Tuscon!"

(TA=
G)

Preston




On Fri, Apr 16, 2010 at 11:20 PM, Sandy <magicquartz@yahoo.=
com> wrote:
>
>
>
> Tucson was good at ignoring torment. Especially when it=
 came from Hydras or the other Predacons and Decepticons. He then realized =
by the feel of his restraints, that yes, they were next to near impossible =
from escape. To break them was not an option, but, perhaps Ninjabot trainin=
g could come in handy as far as finding ways around the loop holes. He coul=
d sense that the more he expanded his hydraulics on his wrists and ankles, =
the tigher and less comfortable they were on him. Meditation again would co=
me in handy. The more he relaxed, the more limber his body would become. Pe=
rhaps even limber enough to give him more room to move in his tight quarter=
s. Yet he was still waiting to hear Rodimus's reply to his question. When t=
he answer doesn't come, he realizes that he'd have to get through to him a =
different way.
>
> " I remember the battle, although it was a bitter memory=
. We were desperately fighting against Hydras, me myself, barely able to fe=
nd off the Predacons, but I did. Then, it started to happen. Things were ge=
tting out of control real fast and there were no more Autobots with conside=
rable speed available, for diversionary tactics. In that time, I was open t=
o assist, and then everything was happening at once. You were being chased,=
 along with windlord and Nightlight. Being who I am, and who I was at the t=
ime, to me, there was no such thing as failure. So, I transformed into vehi=
cle mode, and I went as fast as my wheels could take me, although not very =
fast to your standards, but to mine it was far beyond my usual caliber. I y=
elled out your name, and I told you to hold on because I was comming to hel=
p you. I was able to divert the attention away from you and direct it my wa=
y. What I didn't see comming was an energy blast that hit me square in my d=
irectory, causing me to fall into immediate stasis, and before I knew it, e=
verything went black, and after that, nothing. I lost everything. My sight,=
 and even a good portion of my memory. But most of all, I lost the leader t=
hat I respected loyally, and two of my most valuable comrades. I lost you a=
ll because of me, and you think I'm happy with that? I'm not. Because of me=
 you are now how you are, and I'll have that guilt with me for as long as I=
 live. But I'm learning to move on Rodimus, as painful it is for me to reme=
mber the past, I'm moving on. And I believe I can help you do the same, if =
- you can trust me. Hydras would never promise you the support only a fello=
w Autobot can offer, and he would never accept failure as a learning experi=
ence. But to me, Failure is just a nother step toward self improvement. You=
 fall, you get back up, and you roll again. You look back at what you did w=
rong and you correct it. It's all right to make mistakes Rodimus, Primus kn=
ows I've made more than my fair share already."
>
> He hoped that his appro=
ach would possibly break some ground beneath them.
>
> In another cell in t=
he fortress, Night Shift remains calm knowing that Tucson Prime wasn't real=
ly about to give into Hydras. A new plan was in action and all he had to do=
 was wait. Although, getting out of the handcuffs was also on his mind. He =
didn't much care for them, since they were irritating the metal around his =
wrists.
>
> "Slag these things itch like mad."
>
> He tries to scratch the =
itchiness that the cuffs cause him.
>
> Outside the fortress, Rat Trap obse=
rves Phobia's reaction to Quickstride's noxious gas explusion. He sees how =
euphoric it makes her. With his ratty little mind, he gets an idea.
>
> "Hm=
mmm.... I think someone's gettn a buzz off of your fumes Quickstride. Altho=
ugh I dunno what's so great about it, because it smells worse than a rottin=
g carcass."
>
> Quickstride's ears flicker back and forth. He slows from a =
gallop, to a canter and eases himself from trot to walk, turning around to =
watch the Decepticons heading toward the black fortress.
>
> "Hmmm.... Real=
ly? Gettn' a buzz off my aft gas huh? Which one?"
>
> Rat Trap looks around=
 in the sky.
>
> "Well, the redn' white one that just acted a little goofy =
up there.. That's the one. I dunno who that Decepticreep is, but definitely=
 got tipsy off that gas."
>
> Quickstride finds more bean pods and stuffs h=
is mouth with them.
>
> "If that's the case, then, when in doubt... Stink'e=
m out. C'mon Rat Trap, we're gon' back."
>
> Rat Trap gasps.
>
> "ARE YOU O=
UTA YOUR DIRECTORY?! CAN WE SAY SLAGGED IN SECONDS, YA OVER RATED JACKAFT?!=
"
>
> Quickstride looks to Rat Trap. He swallows a whole bunch of bean pods=
 down.
>
> "Maybe I am. Trust me, the more I eat, the better this'll get".
=
>
> He then trots back toward the fortress, turns his rump around, lifts hi=
s tail and breaks the wind around him, sending another gassy cloud of fumes=
 through the wind.
>
> "Ohh yeahhh, nice'n stinky.. Let's see if they'll bu=
y the bait."
>
